number of helpful: 1 of 4 people (25%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 3, 2016
												Note: I played this game long before it was on steam, so my hours played is inaccurate.6/10Short Review:-Great Art Style-Great Music-Unique Lore-Interesting Gameplay Mechanics (for a card game)-Not Pay-to-win (Better cards = win. Pay =/= Better cards. I buy orbs, but always get terrible cards)-Average Gameplay (which gets stale pretty quickly)-Not Many Gametypes-Insane Amounts of Grind Required-Buying Orbs (card packs) is not worth it-RNG RNG RNG RNG RNG and more RNGLong Review:Game of Grind:The gameplay is interesting. Has a fun concept, but the game gets stale fast as 50 percent of games are just beatdowns because one player has a deck with rarer cards. This might not apply for the higher teirs of ranked (the only multiplayer gametype), but in the high silver teir its all about who has the better cards (or top-deck shenanigans). Card games tend to be heavy on the Pay-to-Win model. However, this game is all about grinding. Honestly, (IMO) your money in this game does not go very far. You can buy orbs (packs), but most cards you get are worthless. This makes the purchase of packs unsatisfying. The crafting system is nice, but the exchange rate for cards through crafting is terrible. De-crafting cards gives you basically nothing compared to its original value. The main way of getting cards is through a quest system. By doing all the daily quests, you can recieve a single pack every 2 days. This makes making a deck of 40 cards incredibly boring. The draft mode is decent and can net you some cards, but its not radicaly different from the standard ranked matchmaking. The story is slightly above average and unique, considering it is a card game. The lore is creative, and the voice acting is awesome. The lore's only issue (IMO) is the characters have little depth, so its hard to feel connected or invested in the story. The art style in this game is FANTASTIC. I love the background art, and the pixel art is unrivaled. The music in the game is epic and builds an amazing atmosphere for a card game.This game is a joy to experience due to the uniqueness of its style (the art, music, lore, and game mechanics), but over time it loses its luster because of the slow progression (In a card game its important to be able to build a deck, so the player can grow attached to cards and in turn grow attached to the card game as a whole. However, if you cant build a deck because you only get 5 cards every 2 days, then the whole card game aspect is lost). One improvement to the game I want to see is a way to control the cards you get from orbs. For example the orbs could be faction specific with 3 cards guarenteed to be a certain faction (the last 2 would be random). By doing this cards (which are faction specific) could be easier to obtain, and deck building would be much easier/faster. Also, buying orbs would be more worthwhile as you can actually get what you want (to a certain extent) from the orbs you buy. I hate buying orbs, and only recieveing cards for a faction that I NEVER use (basically I paid money for something I will never use). Yea, I could de-craft then re-craft cards I want (as long as they are low rarity), but the exchange rate is trash and overall not even worth the effort.

number of helpful: 1 of 4 people (25%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 9, 2016
												At first glance, it seems like a complete rip off of hearthstone. it has the same mana mechanic, it has the same card system, it has the same shop, except bigger. And it has foil cards, which serve no real purpose as I've seen yet, except to be disenchanted for more dust... i mean spirit...Yes, at first glance, this review might also seem skewed to be against this game, you would be wrong.While as of this moment, Songhai faction is very strong, the game does seem to try to be balanced. A bit 'more' balance would be nice, as well as some other avenues to utilize cards that I can only assume will be implimented later on.This game actually draws more from Fire Emblem. For those commanders out there who, like me, enjoyed spending an hour on one mission, to do a 'perfect' run, where backstabs reigned supreme and the rock paper scissors of spears swords and so on got our blood boiling in all the good ways.Well... you may not be disappointed too much by this game. While it is still 'early' since so far, as of this review, there's only one expansion to the 'Core' set of cards, which I call Shurima~ There is a backstab mechanic, opening mechanics like in hearth, spells and special abilities like in FE and Hearth.Overall, it does have a lot to offer, and it 'DOES NOT LIE' when refering to itself as a ccg with a strategy spin, I would greatly reccomend this game to anyone who likes card games, or strategy. The pixel art is not too bad honestly. it reminds me a lot of the Undertale attempts. So far, the only frustration new players might face, is asking themselves if they should save up for packs from the shop, or use gold for Gauntlet Runs (Gauntlet is basically Arena) the rewards are not too bad, in that you get Spirit for crafting, and usually a core pack along with gold. As long as the people behind this game pay attention to community feedback, and keep adding things for us to buy, and new cards for us to test strategies with, I can see this game lasting quite a while.My one big wish for this game, would be cooperative play, with a friend. 2v2... that would be so amazing if they could pull that off. Perhaps doubling the board size, or something. But if they did that, I would be so happy.

number of helpful: 1 of 4 people (25%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 22, 2016
												Another game that shows why Steam needs a mixed rating. I enjoy playing for free with the daily challenges and single player, which act as standalone puzzles that don't require any grinding or payment. On the monetization side, I'm echoing the voices about how shady the promotional tactics are.The Humble Bundle new account creation promo for 3 free $10 card packs isn't actually that big of a deal, but what shakes my confidence is how they marketed discounted booster packs beforehand.It actually doesn't take that much time to get to that point, though maybe that's a red flag in its own way. There's perhaps an understandable catch-22 with that situation. If the 3 card packs were easy to grind for, why the hell are they $30? If the 3 card packs were hard to get on the other hand, existing players just got burned.  As is, the issue is less about new accounts having an advantage, and more of the store having questionably expensive items.But again, as long as you have realistic expectations for the F2P nature of multiplayer, the single player challenges are quite fun. Matchmaking for completely new accounts is also not a bad experience since you'll be matched with other newbies, but I hear that higher tiers begin to reveal the typical pains of any collectible games that allow grinding with time or paying for boosts.

content:
Posted: October 25, 2016
												An incredibly well designed, fun and addictive tactics/collectible card game. Very, very solid gameplay with frequent updates and balance changes (roughly twice a month). A ton of collectible cards, incredible 8-bit graphics and A VERY FRIENDLY player base. Seriously, people on here are kind, helpful and not toxic which was a pleasant surprise. Fun daily quests. At first glance the gameplay may seem easy to get into, with it being very friendly to newcomers but it's actually quite in-depth and sophisticated. Hands down the best card/tactical game I've played in a while. The fact that it got me hooked for hours and hours the very first day I found about it speaks for itself.Do you like Magic: The Gathering? Do you like Hearthstone? Do you like Heroes 3? Do you like strategic games that require careful positioning and tactical thinking? Wellp, look no further - Duelyst is the game for you!10/10 gorgeous game

content:
Posted: September 23, 2016
												A very interesting take on the genre that combines the normal card collecting formula and having it all take place on a 5x9 hexgrid, emphasizing the importance of positioning your minions appropriately as well as determining when to push up with your general or make a tactical retreat.As for the free to play formula; it's very generous. In comparison to games such as Hearthstone; the gold rate is very high and the drop rate for legendaries is about four times as often; however, that is offset that every card can have up to 3 cards in a 40 card deck, regardless of rarity.I'd definitely recommend checking out the game; if only just to try it. The game is generous in the begining with handing out gold and it also provides various challenges that are akin to chess challanges, discovering how to find lethal and rewarding the player for succeeding while learning in the process and getting accustomed to the hexgrid style gameplay.

content:
Posted: September 18, 2016
												This game is an incredibly enjoyable Hearthstone-Like game.It adds another layer of strategy as you place your minions on the battlefield and controle them. Your general is also Controllable.There are different factions with some cards exclusive to their factions but there are also a big number of neutral cards.In addition to regular daily quests like "play 4 games as Faction X", "Deal X damage in one game", "Kill X minions in one game" etc. It also offers a daily challenge, which is a scenario in which you have to defeat the enemy in one turn with the cards available to you. There are also a number of Challenges that serve as an "advanced" tutorial, teaching you some mechanics.I found it rather easy to get the gold for Spirit orbs, which contain 5 cards each and at least one rare. But I also got a number of epics and just this morning(although that was big luck probably? 2 Legendaries in one Orb. Averaging out on about 4 legendaries in the roughly 20 orbs I opened so far.Some epics will be awarded to you for the beginner quests and upgrading your faction ranks. Upgrading your faction will also award you some of the basic cards of that faction, as well as an additional Commander at level 10.What I don't like is that there is the regular pvp mode is also the Ladder mode. This means if you want to try out a new deck you can only try it against the rather easy AI or risk your season ranking(I dont really mind but some people might).

number of helpful: 0 of 2 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 23, 2016
												Been playing this game before the steam release. It's awesome. Best CCG / Strategy game right now!Big emphasis on skill, having better or more cards in your collection doesn't guarantee you success. It's all about tactis and strategy. Skill is the name of the game here.Very F2P friendly, if you invest time in it. You get gold easily with quest and winning rewards. It uses the same monetazation model as Hearthstone but it's easier to get packs.This game also has a game mode were you create a deck from scratch without taking into account your collection. The more wins you rack in this mode, the bigger your reward.Also, an expansion is coming next week and i'll re-review this by the time it goes live.10/10 for me, if you like card games and strategy!

content:
Posted: September 17, 2016
												I like the card and character art. It also feels pretty balanced so far as a noob, I haven't gotten frustrated or felt like someone else beat me because they bought cards. It's very polished, even the UI. The main thing I like about it is that it's different from all the other CCGs: you summon the creatures from your cards onto the grid-based battle fiend. You then move the creatures into position and attack. Way more fun than the usual card vs. card effect, both from a visual as well as a tactical standpoint.

number of helpful: 0 of 2 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 25, 2016
Imagine Hearthstone and Chess together...NOW GET THOSE MADAFAKAS  AWAY CUZ IT AINT NOTHING LIKE THOSE! LMAO!SERIOUS REVIEW!!!The one thing I like about Duelyst is the [Daily Challenge] feature. Basically, it's a minigame where they set up this situation where you have a lethal combo in your hand and the board itself. Now, it's up to you to pull off that one turn lethal move!What I'm saying is that this minigame preserve your gameplay mechanics (or in other words, it keeps your game level in tip-top shape).I'm gonna be honest, figuring out on how to get that lethal combo was stressful af. It made me wanted to quit! You'll think that this is some bs challenge that you'll never beat......but HOHOHO! Once you FINALLY figured it out, you'll get this SWEET SWEET feeling like you are the biggest smartass in the world.Overall, it's an awesome game and don't worry, it is super beginner friendly too. TOTALLY RECOMMENDED!

content:
Posted: September 7, 2016
												This game is simply amazing. In my opinion its way better than Hearthstone.What is this game?This game is a collectible card real-time strategy game with over 300 different cards, monthly updates and is completely free. Its noob friendly, has a good purchase policy and a good community.ProsNoob friendlyEasy to pick up, hard to masterA lot of synergies, decks and cardsVery good pixel artVery good animationsMatches doesnt last for more than 10 minConsSome cards are currently broken and blatantly OPSome decks are really good, and some suck.9.6/10 must download

number of helpful: 0 of 2 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 10, 2016
												Way more control over your strategy compared to hearthstone due to being able to replace 1 card each turn. Tactical grid allows for more ways to gain advantage even with weaker deck/hand. All hearthstone analogies aside, it's a mixture of poker and chess, where you look for a good card combination in your hand, while trying to outmaneuver your enemy on a tactical grid.Artstyle is stunning, both pixel fx and overall concept art. Another pretty cool, though not crucial, feature is a codex menu with a bunch of short narrated lore entries that go with unique soundtracks and artworks and new ones get added once in a while with game updates. Can't praise this game enough, highly recommended.

content:
Posted: August 27, 2016
												Played before it came to Steam and loved it. Waiting for the mobile version to come out so I can play more often but I like it a lot more than Hearthstone. Definitely recommend if you're looking for a new TCG and if you enjoy tabletop-style games. Some people find the pixel art in game unappealing but I enjoy it. It's definitely worth a try since this game is still rolling out new content and you'll be able to see it grow and progress from the very beginning. Requires no money spending to get new cards as ingame currency is pretty easy to get from quests.

number of helpful: 0 of 2 people (0%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: September 22, 2016
												This is my favorite CCG, hands down. The replace mechanic and combat grid give Duelyst a tactical edge that mitigates luck elements. And almost everything is competely free if you're willing to grind.Pros: - Unique presentation - Beautiful art - Lore, for those who wish to read it - Full control over deck construction and playstyle - Easily obtainable booster packs - Basically everything that was good about Hearthstone, and much more - Short wait times; lots of active players - Fair match-making puts emphasis on playing well instead of paying money for better cards - Ability to tip loser for a good game - Only two card sets are out right now, so collecting isn't overwhelming yet. - No faction pairings seem grossly unbalancedCons: - Currently, there is no free way to unlock loot crates past your first one. Since loot crates are the prize for competing in the season ladder, this really needs to change. - No way to express certain vital emotions like "shrug" or "sorry" without paying real money or lots of in-game currencyIt's free. Try it for a few hours and see if it tickles ya. If you're looking for a deeply tactical CCG, this should be on your list.

content:
Posted: August 27, 2016
												English:A-M-A-Z-I-N-GMore than 50 hours during beta and release. If you like card games you will love this. Chess + Hearthstone without the cons of HS (money money money and RNG).If you're not convinced of the pixel animations, shake off that damn prejudice and download it, when you test the gameplay not only won't care about animations you will begin to like them and you will observe carefully all of them.A large and great community that like being part of with tournaments for beginners and more advanced in which anyone can participate.Between the daily rewards and gold for play the game, in a month you will have a good collection to make decks. I paid the initial offer pack of 10 euros (one time purchase) to support developers, which are very active in Reddit and take note of feedback from players.Besides the legendary percent for orb (card pack) is higher, but that does not matter because you can reach the Golden League (level 10) without legendary and a OP deck, you only need your deck makes sense and cover the weaknesses you may have.Do not forget to look for a single-use code to get an orb (card pack) free to start (there are everywhere).See you on the board !!Spanish: I-N-C-R-E-I-B-L-EMás de 50 horas en beta y su release. Si te gustan los juegos de cartas este te encantara. Ajedrez + Hearthstone sin los fallos que tiene el HS (mucho dinero y RNG).Si no te convencen las animaciones pixelados...sacudete ese maldito prejuicio y bajatelo, cuando pruebes la jugabilidad no solo no te importarán menos las animaciones si no que te empezarán a gustar y te fijaras en todas ellas.Una gran comunidad de la que gusta formar parte con torneos para novatos y para más avanzados en el que cualquiera puede participar.Entre las recompensas diarias y el oro por jugar en un mes tendrás una buena colección con la que hacer mazos. Yo pagué la oferta inicial del pack de 10 euros (compra de una sola vez) para apoyar a los desarrolladores, los cuales son muy activos en Reddit y toman nota del feedback de los jugadores.Además el porcentaje de legendarios por orbe (sobre) es más elevado, pero eso da igual porque puedes alcanzar la Liga de Oro (nivel 10) sin legendarios ni un gran mazo, solo necesitas que tu mazo tenga sentido y cubrir las debilidades que pueda tener.No olvideis buscar un código de un solo uso para conseguir un orbe (sobre) gratis al empezar (los hay por todos lados).Nos vemos en el tablero!!

content:
Posted: September 17, 2016
												I like the card and character art. It also feels pretty balanced so far as a noob, I haven't gotten frustrated or felt like someone else beat me because they bought cards. It's very polished, even the UI. The main thing I like about it is that it's different from all the other CCGs: you summon the creatures from your cards onto the grid-based battle fiend. You then move the creatures into position and attack. Way more fun than the usual card vs. card effect, both from a visual as well as a tactical standpoint.

content:
Posted: August 25, 2016
Imagine Hearthstone and Chess together...NOW GET THOSE MADAFAKAS  AWAY CUZ IT AINT NOTHING LIKE THOSE! LMAO!SERIOUS REVIEW!!!The one thing I like about Duelyst is the [Daily Challenge] feature. Basically, it's a minigame where they set up this situation where you have a lethal combo in your hand and the board itself. Now, it's up to you to pull off that one turn lethal move!What I'm saying is that this minigame preserve your gameplay mechanics (or in other words, it keeps your game level in tip-top shape).I'm gonna be honest, figuring out on how to get that lethal combo was stressful af. It made me wanted to quit! You'll think that this is some bs challenge that you'll never beat......but HOHOHO! Once you FINALLY figured it out, you'll get this SWEET SWEET feeling like you are the biggest smartass in the world.Overall, it's an awesome game and don't worry, it is super beginner friendly too. TOTALLY RECOMMENDED!

content:
Posted: September 10, 2016
												Way more control over your strategy compared to hearthstone due to being able to replace 1 card each turn. Tactical grid allows for more ways to gain advantage even with weaker deck/hand. All hearthstone analogies aside, it's a mixture of poker and chess, where you look for a good card combination in your hand, while trying to outmaneuver your enemy on a tactical grid.Artstyle is stunning, both pixel fx and overall concept art. Another pretty cool, though not crucial, feature is a codex menu with a bunch of short narrated lore entries that go with unique soundtracks and artworks and new ones get added once in a while with game updates. Can't praise this game enough, highly recommended.

content:
Posted: September 15, 2016
												[ENG] This strategic game is the perfect mix between Hearthstone and Duel of champions. The style is really awesome, every unit has its own detailed animation and also the general HUD is cool.Well, the gameplay is very simple, if you already know Hearthstone then you'll already know the gameplay of Duelyst. However, even if i enjoyed it, the common problem that affects all these kind of "strategic" games is the balancing of gameplay (Decks that counters certain decks, some cards too overpowered).That's why, even if i could recommend this game, i'm gonna leave this game after Hearthstone as well.These games are strategic only partially since you also have to rely on luck.[ITA] Questo gioco strategico è il perfetto mix tra il famoso gioco di carte Hearthstone e Duel of champions. Lo stile è veramente figo, ogni unità sul campo di battaglia ha la propria animazione ben curata, la grafica del menù e dell'HUD in generale è altrettanto bella.Beh, il gameplay è molto semplice e intuitivo, se già conoscete come funziona Hearthstone non avrete problemi nel giocare Duelyst visto che dal punto di vista di gameplay sono pressocchè identici.In ogni caso, anche se mi è piaciuto giocare questo titolo, il problema comune che affligge questo tipo di giochi strategici è sempre lo stesso: il bilanciamento del gameplay (Determinati deck che counterano certi tipi di deck, carte troppo potenti).Ecco perchè, nonostante possa raccomandare di provare questo gioco, smetterò di giocarci così come ho fatto con Hearthstone.Questi giochi sono strategici solo in parte, dato che bisogna sempre contare anche sulla fortuna.

number of helpful: 0 of 2 people (0%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: September 22, 2016
												This is my favorite CCG, hands down. The replace mechanic and combat grid give Duelyst a tactical edge that mitigates luck elements. And almost everything is competely free if you're willing to grind.Pros: - Unique presentation - Beautiful art - Lore, for those who wish to read it - Full control over deck construction and playstyle - Easily obtainable booster packs - Basically everything that was good about Hearthstone, and much more - Short wait times; lots of active players - Fair match-making puts emphasis on playing well instead of paying money for better cards - Ability to tip loser for a good game - Only two card sets are out right now, so collecting isn't overwhelming yet. - No faction pairings seem grossly unbalancedCons: - Currently, there is no free way to unlock loot crates past your first one. Since loot crates are the prize for competing in the season ladder, this really needs to change. - No way to express certain vital emotions like "shrug" or "sorry" without paying real money or lots of in-game currencyIt's free. Try it for a few hours and see if it tickles ya. If you're looking for a deeply tactical CCG, this should be on your list.

content:
Posted: October 26, 2016
												A solid trading card game mixed with the best aspects of turn based tactics games. A stiking art style who's pixel art is not only top notch, but allows for the impressive variety of minions and spells available to you. The business model is also about as fair as you can be, with booster packs priced similar to other popular digital card games and a fair number of cosmetic items for sale as well. Plenty available to make no two games the same.

content:
Posted: October 26, 2016
												You might look at my profile and see I only have a handful of hours logged into the game. Yeah, I'd usually never ever write a review this early, but to be honest, I've seen enough to at least speak my mindPros:- Not pay 2 win- Like I said above, everything can be bought with enough grinding, and nothing feels like if you buy it you will instantly be overpowered- Great community! Like, wow, this community is awesome. I've had nothing but good experiences with all the forums, so if you're intimidated by the game, try not to be. This game is played by some really chill and awesome people- Great graphics that have a style all to their own- YO DAWG THE DRAFT MODE FROM HEARTHSTONE IS HERE BUT WAY BETTERCons:- Ya know, the basic stuff, like luck not liking you, not getting good cards, etc.- Currently, the races (called Generals in game) have some very clear cut things you can do with them well. There are some not so clear cut ways to use them, I'm sure, but there's this one race. THIS ONE RACE, that I ran into.- THE SONGHAI- Trust me, the race isn't ridiculously overpowered, but they have great cards, and will literally erase you from the game if you get a good one.BTW, there this referral system that's in place, it gets you 100 gold in game which allows you to buy a card pack.My referal code was already used by someone who read my review!

content:
Posted: March 26
												Gameplay- 9/10 .  Default game cards favor empty boards for most factions.  Random elements in faction bloodsurge spells can literally turn matches into coin tosses.  Most of the time, the game plays great.  Some cards truly favor the spender, so the pay to win factor may appear, but there are divisions of players who don't own everything.Visuals - 10/10 Nothing like it, menu screen is amazing, game graphics are enjoyable and memorable, and never visually difficult or displeasing.Content - 7/10  Lack of depth to the game story, completely reliant on PvP for complete immersion.  Factions have few generals.  The game plays out in a variety of ways, but skins don't exist for factions  (as far as i know) limiting what games actually look like- so eventually the visually stunning game looks repetitive.Cost - 10/10  You can unlock the game by playing it.  The cards you are given at the beginning are fairly effective for the thrifty player.Overall 36/40 for a 90%, or A grade.  Impressive.  Fun while it lasts.

content:
Posted: March 26
												Really good TCG. Unit positioning is a real thing, unlike in Hearthstone, because this works on a 2D plane rather than 1D (i.e. you move up and down as well as left and right... in Hearthstone you only worry about positioning, if ever, with left and right). Adds a lot of depth to the format and makes card games legitimately fun to play for me.

content:
Posted: September 12, 2016
September 12, 2016Duelyst is a fair and free strategy game built around card usage. I emphasize the strategy elements over the card collection, as the tactical combat area really sold me on the game. Unit placement and positioning is important, and units can only attack in specified ranges. Combat feels fast, leading to well-paced matches.Duelyst is easy to pick up and play, with solid tutorials and rewarding practice options. The monetization elements are very subdued, and free players can have a great time with the game. Give the game a few hours, I'd highly recommend it.

												An incredible online card game, Duelyst takes the best elements of the hearthstone card and combat system and mixes it with a fire emblem style tactics grid and what you get is something as accessable and approachable as hearthstone but with an extra level of complexity that i found held my attention a lot better then hearthstone. as for the bussiness mode itself it's almost identical to hearthstone so it's not hard to complain and they even have extra cosmetic items that can be bought with completely free currency. if nothing else i'll say this game is great and being completely free theres no reason not to at least try.

												Brilliant. I wasted hours just trying to defeat the daily challenge. It's like being stuck in a very rewarding game of chess. But this is no chess. This is ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ed better. Duelyst possesses great potential. Imagine playing this in a larger scale? Yes, every match would last longer, but I bet it would also be much more fun. The key is to make every players glad, even when defeated. In the last match I played, I was overwhelmed, surrounded by enemy's minions, but one of my minion managed to deal double damage to enemy's general; his hit point reduced to only one. Though I lost in the end, the experience of almost turning the battle with one single hit makes the whole gaming experience superb.

												Duelyst is a pretty amazing game. I didnt expect to like it as much as I do, seeing as its a card game and all, though I did enjoy playing MTG and Yugioh and such, but the elements of those games are only somewhat present in this. I couldn't directly compare the colors in magic to the generals in Duelyst, but I can find similarities. Like the Vanar, they're similar to blue. Also, if you enjoy strategy games, like Fire Emblem, or X-COM, or such, you will definitely enjoy this game.P.S: If you sign up and use someones referral code, you start with 100 gold, and they can get bonuses if you play it enough. So, the way I see it, I'll give everyone who reads this my referral code, so you can start off on a better foot in it, and if you end up liking the game, I get bonuses for helping you like it. Win-win! :DMy Referral code is "zicatipus". Good luck and I hope you enjoy this awesome game!

number of helpful: 0 of 2 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 14, 2016
												Tried this game because I'm a longtime fan of both tactics and card games. The tactics portion adds a lot to the standard card game lineup, and feels like an experience not to be missed.I've started playing this a little more regularly than Hearthstone lately because the tactics portion adds a good amount of depth without things getting too crazy: Hearthstone feels like it gets solved every month or two, to the point that you can't play a fun deck, because you'll just hang out in the high-teens.  People netdeck something and it plays itself.  The positioning in this game adds a whole new way for you and your oponent to screw up, and so your fun deck is going to throw you higher.My biggest complaint here is the art. I think its fantastic pixel art, but the grid-based system causes the fantastic pixel art to not-integrate with the environment very well.  Kinda just a problem with tactics games in general - with this one stressing the point more without clever environmental interactables.Overall, grand game. Hope it keeps up. Haven't dropped a dollar on any other digital CCG besides Hearthstone, but this one caused me to open my wallet.  Haven't yet bought in too deep, but it seems pretty inevitable.

content:
Posted: October 20, 2016
												This is my favorite game. I've never played Magic The Gathering, Yu-Gi-Oh, or Hearthstone. I looked into playing Hearthstone after I got into this, thinking that it's similar and being a former WoW player. Hearthstone's free card packs come at about a 30% rate compared to the ones you generate going daily quests in Duelyst. Hearthstone's crafting is considerably more costly value-wise, as well. Blizzard is bad at balancing.Duelyst releases new cards every month, regularly updates imbalances in the meta (and does so fairly, regardless of what salty Vet mains will say), and really cares about its playerbase. When they added Prismatic cards to the game, people who had played before then didn't get any at first- card packs opened past that point just had more value than previously. People complained about this, and a while later they gave pre-patch players FREE prismatic cards based on how many packs they had opened previously. They could have made random cards in our collections prismatic and told us that would could enough (despite that not taking into account disenchanted cards) but they did the right thing and gave us free cards to match the value. Yes, there are a TON of purchasable cosmetic items, but let me put this to you: people who complain about having the OPTION to purchase cosmetic items and emotes in a free game are massive babies... especially when the skins and emotes are purchasable with spirit/dust for free too.

number of helpful: 0 of 2 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 14, 2016
												Tried this game because I'm a longtime fan of both tactics and card games. The tactics portion adds a lot to the standard card game lineup, and feels like an experience not to be missed.I've started playing this a little more regularly than Hearthstone lately because the tactics portion adds a good amount of depth without things getting too crazy: Hearthstone feels like it gets solved every month or two, to the point that you can't play a fun deck, because you'll just hang out in the high-teens.  People netdeck something and it plays itself.  The positioning in this game adds a whole new way for you and your oponent to screw up, and so your fun deck is going to throw you higher.My biggest complaint here is the art. I think its fantastic pixel art, but the grid-based system causes the fantastic pixel art to not-integrate with the environment very well.  Kinda just a problem with tactics games in general - with this one stressing the point more without clever environmental interactables.Overall, grand game. Hope it keeps up. Haven't dropped a dollar on any other digital CCG besides Hearthstone, but this one caused me to open my wallet.  Haven't yet bought in too deep, but it seems pretty inevitable.

content:
Posted: October 11, 2016
												Awesome game. Finishing off an opponent with a huge combo is soooooo satisfying. Easy to pick up and start playing online in an hour. Requires a fair amount of reading to understand what each card does, but it's not overwhelming. Once you've done one combo you will understand how the cards interact with eachother and the rest is picking up on how the different types of opponents prefer to engage you. There seem to be some complaints about the game becoming sort of paywalled at higher levels. I haven't reached that high enough level to be able to comment on whether or not that is true, but I am truly having fun on the way to finding out. If I get to the point where I'm playing this super competitively and putting in hundreds of hours then I don't mind chipping in, but so far I don't get the feeling you need to pay an arm and a leg in order to have a good time, whatever that means to you.I haven't even explored deck building or card crafting yet and I've been able to beat other players with advanced cards while using only the premade starter decks myself. So the game is fun, challenging, and noob friendly. With the board format it really boils down to a dynamic puzzle game with an element of competition and fantasy theme. Definitely worth your time.

content:
Posted: September 12, 2016
September 12, 2016Duelyst is a fair and free strategy game built around card usage. I emphasize the strategy elements over the card collection, as the tactical combat area really sold me on the game. Unit placement and positioning is important, and units can only attack in specified ranges. Combat feels fast, leading to well-paced matches.Duelyst is easy to pick up and play, with solid tutorials and rewarding practice options. The monetization elements are very subdued, and free players can have a great time with the game. Give the game a few hours, I'd highly recommend it.

content:
Posted: September 21, 2016
												Been playing since November '15 so ignore the lack of hours on my record, it's closer to the 1000-1500 hour mark! The game is very very good. While it starts off slowly, and you will be losing a lot of games to begin with especially if it's your first ever card game you will grow and grow as a player and start to unlock spirit orbs (pack of 5 cards) and start winning games very quickly all while being FREE TO PLAY, and it doesnt require you to buy orbs to be good, although there is the option of that too.Not all of the great cards are Legendary or Epic; one of the best cards in the game is a common, there are plenty of Starter, Common or Rare cards which are very highly rated and can get you to the very top. Granted Legendaries are very good, but they tend to be more of a situational card than something which is insanely overpowered. What sets this aside from other card games is that there is a chess board of such, you move around the board and the cards have a life, positioning is the most important part of the game. You can have a card which can destroy your opponents General in one hit, but if you can't reach them then its useless. RNG is often a big part of card games, while there is some on here, it's limited. You start off with 5 cards in a hand and you get the chance to replace two straight away and then one from each turn onwards. If you know what you're looking for and which cards you need, it's likely you will encounter it for when you need it. + FREE TO PLAY+ Most essential cards are lower rarity+ Limited RNG+ Legendary drop rate is ~1/4+ More than just cards with a board to play on+ Very easy to get gold+ Six different factions to choose from, each with two generals which play as a different archtype- Very Bad S-Rank system (a new one is in the works)- Not as popular as other card games for nowAlso note: If you sign up with a referal, use my name (Browneskiii) to get 100 Gold for FREE. It's free, why not try it atleast? :D

content:
Posted: September 15, 2016
												Duelyst is a game that takes the CCG (collectible card game) and adds a tactical element to create a game that feels more rewarding to skilled players. Players have access to more tools to create consistancy in play, such as reducing the effects of poor draws by granting a system of replacing a card once a turn. The addition of a game board also gives players more tools to preserve resources, such as avoiding enemy minions to conserve health or protecting minions by body blocking or repositioning.Recommend if:- you enjoy turn-based tactics and M:tG/Vanilla HS-style games- you enjoy being rewarded for skilled play and understanding of mechanics- you like drawing multiple cards a turn

number of helpful: 34 of 73 people (47%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 23, 2016
												I want to love this game, but it's turned into an IAP ♥♥♥♥♥how, plain and simple. As a Kickstarter backer, it's disappointing to see a promising pixel turn-based strategy game turn into an IAP saturated Trading Card Game (TCG). I summarily pulled my backing after the announcement was made.It has since become a Free2Play TCG, so I decided to give it a try. The good news is that the core gameplay is enjoyable and well paced. All the cards seem to have their place in their respective strategies. The bad news is that in order to make it free, Counterplay Games has crammed every monetization scheme possible into one game.From cosmetics to cards, if they can sell it to you, they will. Avatars, card packs, card backs, character skins, emotes and bundles can all be purchased. Cards are awarded through spirit orbs (read: card packs), which is par for the course if you consider Hearthstone the benchmark for TCGs. The final kicker though are the mysterious crates.Mysterious crates are awarded for ranking up in online play (think leveling up a la Overwatch). The problem is, in order to open a mysterious crate, you have to purchase a key (like CS:GO).Now, I don't necessarily have a problem with any of these pricing models separately, but when they're all combined into one game, it makes me cautious. And even if it can be considered forgivable on its own, Counterplay recently introduced promotional keys for 20 Orbs and Cosmetics (roughly $30 value, $20 card value), but made them only redeemable to new accounts. So if you started playing when Duelyst launched on Steam AND spent $10, you are now on par with new players that have spent nothing. Likewise, they have been "balancing" quests so that you earn less gold and therefore open less packs.All in all, there is an enjoyable game here, but for myself and others who are sensitive to over-monetization, I'm of the opinion that Counterplay Games is leaning heavily towards greed. But I am just a short term player, here is longer (and admittedly better) assessment from a long time player: https://forums.duelyst.com/t/an-open-letter-to-counterplay-games-ardent-dawns-post/3113

content:
Posted: September 20, 2016
												Pros-Good f2p model-Board adds a large strategy element-Amazing card design-Derverse deck buildsCons-Starter decks can only get you so farI feel the begining life of duelyst (beta) was at its most healthiest. There was very little RNG which meant the game played more like chess. This could make many matches play out the same. The newest update added a bit more of RNG and you no longer get 2 cards per end of turn. This made a huge difference in game flow. Value trading is more of a thing now and some people like myself arent too happy with it.Duelyst plays more like a card game now and the changes isnt something im a fan of. But I would agree that it might be better for the longevity for the game.

Posted: September 13, 2016
												Think Chess meets Hearthstone. I love this game, started playing back in beta, just saw that it had been released on steam and wasted no time getting back into it. All of your love of strategy card gaames combined with tactical positioning, it's really fun. Hear a lot of people say it's unbalanced, but really, i feel that way about every card game when i see people throw legendaries all over. It's fun and if you rage quit because somebody spent the time to build up a nice deck, well, sorry, so sad. I wouldn't hesitate to pick this up, pixel graphics are very polished, tactics are head scratchers (<---good thing) and AI is actually not terrible. Get it, it's free.

content:
Posted: September 14, 2016
 Simplistic:  So worth the time, great visuals, great learning curve, FREE and not a pay-2-win,OMGOMGOMG. --- Details:  After about an hour or so of fiddling around, I must say very impressive. 1. Art: Art style is unique, animations amazing. Can be laggy with be many minions out and with certains spells but very short bursts, really no lag. SO its lower PC friendly.2. Game Mechanics: Simple to learn; Hard to master: The tutorial is very straight forward in showing you you how to do the basic actions, but leaves you to your own decisions to figure out what is the correct play and when. Very rewarding in terms of learning each character, or a specific one. Duelysy also has a solo mission complex which have you figure out how to utilize different abilities, about three tries for each personally. :P3. Community: From my observation: Small but very friendly, managed to join the official discord and everyone had something to talk about, even met up with a new buddy and played for about 45 minutes, showing me concepts I realized on my own - through repeated play. Community is active and I really would to see it grow.4. Purchases(Is it really not a pay2win?): The game does allow you to purchase ORBS,(in-game way of unlocking cards) and other commodities for real money, but does not make you any better at the game itself.  Also as far as I can tell, everything is unlockable with SPIRIT.(Currency for crafting or purchasing new items or cosmetics{YEP, COSMETICIS.}) Final say, YES. GET THIS GAME.Also i'm not a professional reviewer anything, but this seemed so worth it to get out there with very poor free to play models on steam. Good Job, Counterplay Games Inc!

content:
Posted: November 14, 2016
Unfortunately, My full review needs to sit on pastebin because of an apparent character limit on steam reviews. It's here.[pastebin.com]The short version: It's a card and board game, much like the one Han Solo and Chewbakka play on the Millenium Falcon, where they play little monsters on a board and make them fight.It's got botmatches, pvp, and 'challenges' that play more like a puzzle than a strategy game.It's got a strict meta and no casual 'unranked' pvp.It's got a cash shop, where you can buy 'orbs' (loot crates) that drop 5 cards. Obviously the more cards you have, the better. You can also buy cosmetics, but they don't affect gameplay. Cards do. Too bad. This means it's P2W. It might not be so P2W that it effects how you enjoy the game, but any change in gameplay is too much for me. Cosmetics Only.It's got a toxic community. What a shame.If you're a card-game nut, have at it. If this will be your first card game, stay away.

content:
Posted: September 22, 2016
												Working unpaid overtime is more fun than playing this terribly imbalanced, disgustingly broken, shameful pay-to-win travesty landfill tripe of a game.Any so-called "depth" only relates to how deep your pockets are - can your 5 dollar bill beat my 10 dollar bill?As a marketing gimmick, they gave out lots of Epic/Legendary cards for breaking orbs in the beginning, but no more - you're lucky to get one for every orb you break - which will cost you real life money or 100 gold from the game. Meaning, if you're STARTING OUT NOW, you're very much in for a Digital Pigsty of garbage, losing match-ups, because your opponents will @$$r@pe you with armageddon-tier unfair cards. Nice r£tarded strategy by the devs to scale their business with a game only 3 weeks old. It's also why it's gonna tank in the next 2.Saw the title mentioned on Humble Bundle and got some free trinkets/codes with the latest bundle there, among them 20 orbs which you can break for 5 more cards to your deck. It was immediately apparent that others had done this too - good luck playing against opponents with 100 trash email accounts and the resulting 100x20 orbs they have used to top off their decks leaving the beginner phase a really rotten experience. I, for one, do not have time for such bull$hit.And this is coming from someone who isn't a fan of Hearthstone at all, but at least can admit it was objectively fair to players of all levels, thus its huge success.I gave Duelyst a few hours of my evening, whereas I should have used it for picking nose hairs with a plier, as that would have been more enjoyable. However, the time spent was enough to discover the shallow game mechanics and the awful graphics that has nothing to offer an already super-saturated market.To emphasize how utterly sloppy and bad it is: It has an "End Turn"-button that don't turn green even when you are CLEARLY out of options. Which is a basic mechanic you should have working in this kind of game, similar to a car having basic wheels and a god damn engine. The graphics are nothing special, just a mediocre blend of pixels and smooth-style backgrounds copy-pasted from the Blizzard equivalent. On top of that some of the sounds are stolen from Diablo 2 and some of the music has been taken from other, older games.Playing was tedious and boring from the start and only got worse; I caught myself checking out what time it was more often than checking out what happened on the board, so non-engaging were the battles.Add to this that some of the players have been receiving copious amounts of spam in their inbox after registering.Stay away if you ain't got the extra money to pay, and even then you'll be bored out of your mind.

content:
Posted: November 19, 2016
												Early impression: I wish that +2/2 or +4/4 grow cards didn't exist when they are very hard for new players to deal with after turn 1 as each turn usually has new players closely trying to outvalue each other with rather low hp minions on board and no dispel or destroy cards to get rid of them. sometimes you also get those 5 turn victories because of poor draws of the enemy and more than often your losses in constructed come from simply not having enough dispel or value to counter the enemy (as high value/dispel/removal cards rarely come up for you to pick).otherwise the game is fun and while there are a lot of cards that feel unbalanced, there is more strategizing involved compared to many other f2p card games - and that makes the game worth playing for some time. Edit: Played for longer and now I'm facing veteran players with custom decks when playing with starting decks, where people have cards with 2x more value than mine. I could summon 2 or 3 mana 2/3s with an effect, but the enemy has 0/6 2 mana totems that summon a 2/2 monster every turn or 2 mana 2/2 Pax that on death summon 2 2/2 dervishes for a total of 6/6 value as THREE monsters  against my (typically) low hp monsters (best probably fenrir warmaster for 6/4 value. Dispels do not have enough value to counter these kind of rush type minions especially when combined with buffed ranged minions because they use all the starting mana, a card from your action bar AND still leave the enemy minions with their original attack/hp values - giving no draw to keep up (and then you have to deal with distance of the ranged enemies or find a dispel for them as well). These are just some examples.The game snowballs too easily and constructed requires heavy RNG in getting to choose cards that synergize and fit the meta. because of requiring a lot of grind to be able to fight against custom high value decks and a lot of rng to do well in constructed, I don't recommend playing more than up to level 11 casually on each class.

content:
Posted: September 21, 2016
												Finally, a F2P game that cares about it's users and their experience over cash flow. Games like this are far and few between. Newbie friendly, visualling appealing and simplistic, it offers so much in terms of gameplay. From PVP ladder to stimulating daily challenges to rapid fire "gauntlet" games, you never get bored. With so many factions and endless possibilities in deck composition, this game gives you the depth you need as either a casual or invested player. Plus, drop rates are WAY better than Hearthstone. I have nothing but good things to say. Regarding the issue with giving new players $20 of new stuff and nothing for us older players, I don't give an eff because I'll toast them anyways. Deuces.

content:
Posted: August 29, 2016
												great game and one of the better balanced games that i have seen in a while, and while the graphics and cards are unique and fun to play with they most certainly have some balancing issues with thier cards and factions. some factions posses cards that let them permanently control any unit. late game this is extreemly frustrating and difficult to manage as you will spend all of your points to summon a powerful monster and next turn the enemy will swoop in with a less powerful card and permanently take your monster. any game that lets a single faction permanently take control of creatures will inherently have balancing issues in my opinion. aside from that, there is a specific faction in the game that has the best starting units and by best they have the highest overal attack and health compared to cost letting them dominate early game and defeting most faction which are designed to last mid to late game. the chess board style as well as the summoning of cards and unique abilities makes the game very strategic and enjoyable. like i said earlier balancing issues certainly get frustrating to deal with but hopefully things will be changed.

number of helpful: 2 of 9 people (22%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: September 28, 2016
												I ran into so many issues within just 24 minutes of "playing" the game that I think I might just quit right away, sorry...Without even playing the actual game appart from the 3 first tutorials, which was clunky and really not that informative at all, you know... getting 5 cards being told you can swap out 2 of them but the tutorial just lets you swap out only one exact card so it can continue the script and give you 2 artifact spells which say "0 mana to cast" but you can only cast 1 ... because the tutorial just wants you to use ONLY 1 right now and then insist on you doing some other stuff, making you think "oh so I can only use 1 artifact per turn ok" but thats not true because when you try doing 2 per turn later on it just works like a charm. and the tutorial displays a huge textbox above the head of a card telling you to play it but that exact same textblock just blocks your sight so you can't even see what the cards description below says. So you end up being forced to play a card that you can't even find out about what it does at all...So In terms of "teaching" me stuff about the game the tutorial just failed alot. Just so so many very basic things going terribly wrong here, again before you even start playing at allNext, the humble keys I got did have a space you had to delete after copy pasting them which took me like 2 minutes to find out by using google which included comments by the actual support/dev/publisher... I dunno (yellow name with an admin star, whatever that means in detail, like... is he a steam Admin, Dev Team Member, Support Admin, Publisher Staff?)https://steamcommunity.com/app/291410/discussions/0/343787283744745839/but what I'm trying to say: if it takes a user just a few moments to figure, then why doesn't it say so somewhere at humble bundle or as a side note at where you put in the keys?2nd: after finaly getting the codes to work, well at least it told me they worked by showing some green marker and then... well just... where is it? Where can I see what I just unlocked? I browsed through all of the game menus multiple times and I cant find any display for these "cosmetic" contents that I assumably just unlocked. And for the second key which should have added some currency "spirit orbs" well... under the crafting menus I found some display saying I still have "0 spirit" dunno if that would refer to "spirit orbs" tho but ye... where is the stuff?And pls dont get me wrong here, I'm not ranting about pretty much free stuff that I should just be thankful for if anything and keep my mouth shut. No I'm talking about a glimpse of experience into the premium content of a game that I might have wanted to play and get some $$$ shizzles for in the future, but when I cant see that stuff anywhere at all, then its simply not worth a single future penny!Anyway, I thought maybe I'd have to restart the client to refresh all the displays (which would be sad enough for a released state game of 2016) but that brings us to:3rd, just on my SECOND EVER attempt to start the game it just locked itself in that very first black screen with the white "Duelyst" logo and it didnt even allow me to simply go to my desktop and shut it down - so it kind of soft locked my entire system which I really dont like at all (which is also partial a Win10 issue but ye... lets say 50/50 on that one)not to mention I still cant see any of the added items after being able to start the game in the end.So all I really wanted to say is: I've seen some potential but before I got even started I'm not really feeling an urge to start the game a 4th time ... ever, because first impressions you know...And I know the game is F2P but thats just the point, if you run a F2P you obviously rely on cosmetics, boosters and other premium microtransactions but when a player can't even get any visual feedback from purchases people just won't buy it...PS: When I try to verify my e-mail to the account using the link from my e-mail I just get redirected to a site telling me that my current browser (Firefox) is not supported and I should install CHROME?! like what?! chrome?! are you serious guys? ANY other game or account I ever tried to verify to within the last like... years would just provide me with a code within verification emails which you can then put into some form if provided links refuse to work but ... CHROME?!

content:
Posted: September 21, 2016
												Ignoring all the reviews from people who were caught out by the free humble bundle intro pack, Duelyst is a terrific game. I've dabbled in a few TGC's before, Magic: The Gathering, Hearthstone etc and this game feels pretty awesome to play. 6 factions with many different playstyles within them, awesome animated pixel sprites, not too much of a grind to buy card packs or 'spirit orbs', at least in comparison to other games like Hearthstone, and awesome visuals and sound design. The game is easy and quick to get into, yet hard to master. 10/10

number of helpful: 2 of 10 people (20%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 30, 2016
												Verdict: Don't waste your time with this game.Pros:This game can be fun. I didn't see the draw at first, but it started becoming fun as I played many practice rounds.Cons:The Cons become apparent as you begin playing enemy players.This is a pay2win game. Either players have invested money to get brutally stronger deck builds or have spammed the free gold/orbs e-mail deal. Needless to say, anyone trying to get into the game will not have much fun.Next, one has to really delve into the game play and type. In a nut shell, it's nothing new. Duelyst does not offer any new ideas or new play styles. It copies straight off of many games fram flash gaming websites.Lastly, I'd like to point out their art in general. It's...slightly amateur. I don't know who they're hiring to do them, but they're not top tier artists. The pixel art are "off" slightly. The way they have done it looks complex, but at the same time looks awful. They just look like blurred blobs with detail in them. The splash art for generals are also rather odd. Their proportions are off, shading is off, just things here and there are slightly off. I'm sure they're hiring these artists to save a buck or two.

number of helpful: 2 of 10 people (20%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 30, 2016
												Pretty broken game to be honest.  I am well versed in trading card games.  But say if you make a 2 mana card an 0/6 that creates 2/2 every turn.  And everyone else needs to pay 2-3 mana just for a 2/2 3/2 2/3.  Then you have a broken card that needs to cost more mana, I cant believe they even let that through.  Not to mention in the same match I first saw that, an iron golem 2/2 creature, in 1 turn magically somehow had provoke, +1+2, +2+2, AND takes no damage from generals.  Provoke+no damage from generals?  Broken.From what I saw, you cannot check what your opponent used to do things, so if they go real fast, you literally have no idea if they are cheating, or just have all the OP cards or what.  I would pull an AVGN on the cartridge if I could.

content:
Posted: September 21, 2016
												I got a code from Humble Bundle for free items on this game so I decided to install it. I don't know why new players were given $30 worth of free things while loyal old players got nothing.1. I install the game to redeem my code.2. I must register in the game with an email and username. Why?3. I must verify my email. I follow the link in an email to verify on the Duelyst site.4. Duelyst website says my browser is not supported. I'm using Firefox. It recommends Chrome.5. I decide not to verify, I'm not downloading Chrome for this junk.6. I open the game and try to find where to redeem my code. It asks me to play a tutorial.7. I decide to skip the tutorial because I just want to redeem the code. I don't want to play yet.8. I'm told if I skip the tutorial, I can never play the tutorial again. Why not?9. I skip it anyway and redeem my code.10. Uninstall.

content:
Posted: September 15, 2016
												Pay to get good cards or 99% lose rate. Starter deck? Sure go verse a veteran with better cards. Matchmaking is so bad. One General/faction is OP as hell. You can spawn a "deathwatch" minion which gains +1/1 when ANYTHING dies, which is extremely broken when you can force 6-10 or more of your 1/1 minions that passively spawn, to kill themselves in one turn. Giving that low cost "deathwatch" minion god-like powers. Broken. Especially since your general (the thing you kill to win) is max health at only 25HP.I wanted to play this to have fun but it left me frustrated at how I was losing because of skilless hack moves, just a cheese fest of using op cards with no real thought given to gameplay or strategy. I really wanted to like this but it let me down.

number of helpful: 3 of 14 people (21%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 4
												This game started out great when I first played it. But ever since the recent patch, I've continued to lose match after match after match, and I know its not because my deck is bad. I'm using one the best decks I've ever built and I've won several games with it. So why now am I losing all my matches all of the sudden? It feels as if Counterplay themselves are rigging the game to make it so I lose all my matches. I hate to be that guy who blames the problems on the developer, but unless all the matches are being hacked by the other player (very unlikely, but not impossible), that's the only answer I have. I hope the developers aren't doing what I fear and favoring my opponents. I know some people are gonna read this and say "You just suck. Get a better deck." Fine, say what you like, but that won't change my opinion on this situation. If it turns out that Counterplay is not involved, then I will immediatly take down this review. But until I'm certain, here it is.

number of helpful: 5 of 19 people (26%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 15, 2016
												Free to play P2W. not enough season brackets. no campaign. extremely grindy. play area is tiny for ranged, all commanders move at the same speed making the more powerful cards worth much more. initial draw seems to be 90% chance it will force a high cost card on you, or three cards that are junk. After the initial draw you can only replace two of the crummy cards you get so you are SOL if you draw all high costs, or all spells or something like that (the game states you can not recycle a card and draw it again... I call bs). While playing note that the game is not using a traditional deck or draw. you can draw any card for any of your draw phases and good luck getting the cards you need even if half your deck is dispel. I enjoy it because I have disposable income, but this game is brutal, prepare to get♥♥♥♥♥♥♥in the bronze league, and silver league. The boss challenges are not really enjoyable, its like here fight the "boss"... fights 95% minoins.... that have two factions of abilities and it seems to draw what it wants with 5+ atack and hp per mininon.... zzzzz

content:

												As much as I love this game I have to give this a negative review, please bear with me.Pros:Great GameplayMore skill based and less RNG/P2W [Keep in mind this is still a CCG]Good reward system to stimulate playQuick growth to better cardsAMAZING graphicsCons:Shady DevsF2P [Many might consider this a pro but to me this has always been a red flag. There's a saying you get waht you pay for.]If you think you might be interested you should honestly try it, but be careful if you decide to invest money.I'm not sure how much you've heard about the devs but they certainly don't seem to care about their loyal fans, just their bits. From misleading them in updates to gipping them with the HB... I won't go into detail but if you'd like to read about it a dedicated fan has written a letter about it (the Humble Bundle gip isn't mentioned in it).https://www.reddit.com/r/duelyst/comments/50paxs/an_open_letter_to_counterplay_games/

number of helpful: 27 of 71 people (38%) found this review helpful5 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: August 25, 2016
												DISCLAIMER: if you like this game then good for you, more power to ya, but for me it was not good enoughfor a recommendationNow before you blindly downvote i just want to make a point. I do not, by any means, hate this game. This would be 7 or even 8/10, but there were multiple problems. The battle system, although strategic, lacks dimension. Although skill plays a major part, i feel like having better cards almost decides the match before it begins, skill only affecting the means of the outcome, rather than the outcome itself.One other problem I have is, although the games art style is ♥♥♥♥ing amazing (I love it SOOOOOO MUCH) and reminds me of games like kingdom, the graphics can lag the game even when i fullfill minimum requirements and set the settings to low. (maybe there were better optimizations,or the ability to disable the shaders chadows and lighting entirely?) On top of that, the game lacks resolution settings, making my tiny monitor a huge hinderance and slowing down gameplay. If these issues are fixed, or even just one, I would be happy to change this review to a thumbs up. But, for me, the game in its current state is unplayable, so I will be sticking to Fire Emblem.P.S. If you bear a similar opinion to me, or just plain like this game, I highly suggest checking out Fire Emblem.

content:
Posted: August 24, 2016
												preface for downvoters: you should be ashamed of yourself automatically downvoting all negative reviews. and you are not really helping yourselves either since every new player that comes here and sees this will know that only a fanboy would downvote a sensible and logical review.i have everything for the game and have played the beta a bit.it is just another ccg with a couple of innovative ideas. but it has also copied the class system from hs which makes it very very boring. see with magic color system people can match up a lot of different cards and make fun decks. here you have classes and basically most classes have 1 deck that is competitive and the rest... well, though luck. so basically there are 2-3 viable decks but even they are very rock-paper-scissorish between each other so you generally just run thru the motions to get your ensured win or loss.and of course the mechanics are pretty shallow since there are units don't have multiple abilities/attacks, no instants, no permament resource cards (like lands in magic) nor is there any hand manipulation, deck manipulation, graveyard...bottom line is that hs embraces the whole rng thing and that is fine. it is what it is. i have complete collections in both and sometimes i like kicking it in hs and others in mtg. this game is basically hs without the fun rng, magic without the fun mechanics, and a turn-based squad combat without fun multiple attacks/abilities for each unit.keep in mind that thumbs down is not 0/10 or whatnot. it is not even 5/10, probably 7 or even 8/10.  the situation with online ccgs is basically like mobas. you trully have to deliver something amazing and probably still not going to get a thumbs up or get big which is very important for a game such as this since tournaments, deck ideas, content updates, are only possible if the game is super succesful which unfortunately duelyst will never be.

content:
Posted: August 24, 2016
												The metagame is combo-based. You draw your 2 or 3 card combo out of 40 card deck - they lose. otherwise - you lose. It's that simple. Sure, there are control decks that just stall the board until they get their cards, or rush that say "your deck has to have at least 1/4 of provoke or healing effects, otherwise you lose". But in the end it's just that - you draw your combo or they do. Lots of anger comes from this.But the daily quests are easy to do and the fights themselves are not long that's definately a plus. The graphics are well done, though it may be difficult to distinguish between what minions are on the field.

number of helpful: 10 of 59 people (17%) found this review helpful5 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: August 24, 2016
												Disclaimer: I have 30 hours played of this game not through Steam, but I wanted to write a review since it appears to be newly added here.Rating: 6/10This game attempts to combine hearthstone and chess, and the fusion is just awkward. The developers went overboard trying to cover up how rigorously they copied the formula for Hearthstone, and ended up renaming card effects to laughably awkward names, such as renaming battlecry to "opening gambit". Not so ironically the only features of the game that werent directly taken from Hearthstone or Chess are the worst ones, such as the "face forward" feature. Essentially your characters always face the same direction from the start of the match. This was implemented so that they could add "backstab" and "infiltrate" to the game. Two crappy features that basically reward you for a positional advantage. While that might sound cool at first it basically just boils down to nerds trying to teleport behind you and get an OTK doublestrike. The clunkiness of the board makes it so that it's not rare at all to be standing back to back with the enemy general. For a few hours the game has its charms, but then becomes extremely bland. The only positive things I can say about the game are that the sprites are fantastic, and the single player challenges present some fun puzzles for a few hours of entertainment.

												Seems like a really good game but I can't deal with how hard the sell is. I understand they need to make money, and I intended to pick up a few packs/orbs, I did buy the full expansion set. I'm fine with selling packs, emotes, skins all that stuff, but what I can't deal with is the key system. Basically giving you half the prize is nothing but a carrot on a stick and I find it distasteful. I recently uninstalled Paragon for the exact same reason. However I feel it's worse here as my friend opened up prismatic (shiny) cards from these chests, it's not just cosmetics. Like I said though, there is a great game here. If the key thing doesn't bother you then go for it. I half wish I wasn't so put off by the practice, but for myself personally, I can not recommend a game using this system.

content:
Posted: August 23, 2016
												The art direction in this game is amazing.  Combined with the music and story, it creates an immersive experience.Other than that, the gameplay itself is boring at best.  Anyone trying to compare the gameplay to Fire Emblem or Advance Wars has played neither game.  Sure, both use sprites, but the depth of strategy in both games goes much, much deeper than this game ever will.If you haven't noticed yet, all of the positive reviews have basically 100% like rates, and the negative reviews have 0% like rates.  This is a reflection of the fact that the only people who even bother playing this game anymore are the cult followers who have invested so much time into the game that if they quit then they will be forced to come to terms with how much of their time was wasted.  They carry on in delusion.As with most people, I played the game in Beta, and watched it on Twitch when it was streamed by the many Hearthstone players.  But alas, they don't play this game anymore.  Why is that?  Because the overwhelming majority of people realized that this game is boring and stopped watching.  This game is hardly streamed anymore by larger streamers because they lose viewers and therefore revenue from just playing the game.Don't let these positive reviews fool you.  The only people writing reviews are the circle jerk minions that worship the game, as you can clearly see from the like-dislike ratio I mentioned earlier.Actual chess is more fun than this game.

												Very good card game. Tactical board style, unique graphics and a lot of class and gameplay variety. Unlike Hearthstone, you get card packs here very quickly, thus the making of your own style of decks doesn't require any money if you wish. With this the legendary drop rate is about 5x higher than in HS, which is a needed aspect for getting into card games in my opinion.TL;DR It's free, it's awesome, go give it a try and see it's superior to HS.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: March 12
												Amazing blend of turn based strategy and card combat games.  I've actually played this game since beta, but only recently got it on Steam.  VERY viable to be a completely free player, but cash purchases are also fair yet feel quality and worthwhile.  Strategy will take you a lot further than money will, unlike similar games in the genre.  Rewards are frequent and generous, so it doesn't feel as tedius if you were to earn your way rather than purchasing.I've only gotten to high gold rank (7, you start at 30, diamond begins at 5).  I had only spent $10 by then and it was only to support the game at the moment in time, it was not at all necessary.  I don't know if you'd ever truly need to spend money to compete, but if you really needed the entire card library at your hands, chances are you're very high rank and very dedicated to the game by then and willing to spend your way.This game also has a gauntlet mode similar to HS arena where you draft a deck so there is no way to buy better odds of victory.  You earn gold much faster than other games and can regularly buy keys (keys are purchasable with both earned gold and cash).All in all this is both the best competive card game and competitive turn based strategy game on the market.In addition to the ranked pvp, there are plenty of puzzles and challenges to both practice and earn gold without the pressure of playing against other players for those who stress that.  There used to be a new puzzle challenge daily, which are temporarily suspended for developments sake but are supposed to be returning later.  There are also special pve boss battle challenges that will really test your skill and teach you to deal with ridiculous odds stacked against you.This game is also free, if you even remotely like either card or strategy games, just install it and thank me later.P.S. when you make an account, get a referral code off of a friend or your favorite streamer.  You'll get 100 bonus gold to start with and if you stick with the game and rank up you'll earn them nice bonuses too!

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: March 20
												I've been playing Duelyst for over a year now, and while I don't sink quite as many hours into it as I used to, it's still a really fun card game that I would definitely recommend. The pixel art is some of the best I've seen, the board mechanics bring an extra level of strategy to duels, and the card mechanics are really dynamic and fun. There are a few things about the game that are sorta unfun, like Vanar being a faction heavily based around cheap removal (or just the plethora of cheap removal in general), but otherwise there's very few gripes I have about this game. Everything in the game can be earned over time by just playing if you don't want to spend money, and high rarity drops from the core set are very high. This game definitely has a bit of a learning curve though, so if you're looking at a game to play when your brain is turned off, this might not be the one for you, but if you want an engaging and fun card and tactics game, this should be right up your alley.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: March 18
												I've put nearly 200 hours into this game since I found it a couple of months ago.  It presents fascinating challenges in positional play, hand management, and deckbuilding.   There's a ton of variety - each faction plays differently, and there are enough builds and combos (even with only the basic cards) to keep you interested for a long time.  Although tactically deep, the battles are refreshingly short - lasting 10-15 minutes on average.It's also easy to get into without spending a lot of (or any) money - you can buid a strong deck with just the basic cards, and the model is generous enough that you could probably build one that's top-level within a couple of weeks.

content:
Posted: September 25, 2016
												Great game. Duelyst is only two days old but I've already sunk 20 hours into it, which is not something I do often... (help). I've played a decent amount of TCGs in my lifetime aand I think the last grid-based rpg I played was FFTactics Advance on the GBA, so thats some background for relevance. Don't really like having to write out full reviews when recommending a game that I like and want to succeed, so I'll just jot down some bullet points.-6 faction decks to choose from. Each with different playstyles / approaches. number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: September 26, 2016
												This is the brain child of Mage Wars and Hearthstone getting together finally, and in no way is it a bad thing. If you have played Hearthstone at all you will instantly see the influence of the game. The booster packs cost the same, the draft mode cost the same. You get daily quest, and completing them will give you gold. The Mage Wars portion comes in the checker board combat where you and your creatures are physically represented in the world and requires a whole new layer of strategy that Hearthstone does not offer, given that you can move your avatar in and out of combat, block off impending attacks with a wall of your own creatures, and need to be aware of what's on the field, what can potentially make it to you, and where you may need to go. How does it go for someone who doesn't pay? I don't pay, I ranked up to 18 in the Silver league last night. While not super impressive, I haven't spent a dollar on the game. Simply grinding out gold on the Solo quests offered, which provide you a scenario and challenge you to kill the opponent in one turn ala Magic the Gatherings video game iterations, and from doing the daily quests that I was offered. The booster packs have been more than enough to supplement my deck nicely and I find the game quite enjoyable. The long term con I can see to this game is of course, what else can they do with it? The draft mode is fun, but I'm not going to pay for gold, which means I can only draft when I grind out the required 150. Hearthstone got to the point where I was only logging on to play the Brawl mode because they were fun and offered unique games that were quite memorable. Once you complete the Solo portion, which I haven't yet, where does it go from there? Will you continully have to beat your head against ladder play, hoping to slowly grind out gold till you can buy your next booster pack? If so I could very easily see a lull coming in the game for my future. Despite these reservations, I have still enjoyed the game, for the little time that I've been playing.All in all, this is a fantastic game, that requires a both a head for strategy, deck building, and card playing. My only concern, where does it go from here?
